definitions.definition: a spoken or written request to somebody to do something or to go somewhere
definitions.sensetop: invitation to somethinginvitation for somethinginvitation from somebody/somethinginvitation to do something

examples.text: I **received an invitation** to the party
She repeated her invitation for dinner at her place.
We got a wedding invitation from Alex and Chris.
I have an **open invitation** *(= not restricted to a particular date)* to visit my friend in Japan.
I must sadly decline your generous invitation.
The head extended an invitation to all parents to come and see the school.
We'd love to take up your invitation to visit you sometime.
I got a baby shower invitation from a friend.
Have you received your invitation to the exhibition?

definitions.definition: the act of inviting somebody or of being invited

examples.text: He produced an official letter of invitation.
A concert was held at the invitation of the mayor.

definitions.definition: a card or piece of paper that you use to invite somebody to something

examples.text: We've already sent out the invitations.
Have you ordered the wedding invitations yet?

definitions.definition: something that encourages somebody to do something or encourages something to happen, usually something bad
definitions.sensetop: invitation to somebody (to do something)invitation to something

examples.text: Leaving the doors unlocked is an **open invitation** to burglars.
Putting the kids in charge was an invitation to disaster.

wordOrigin: late Middle English: from French, or from Latin invitatio(n-), from invitare.
